timeline.message: Move methods around to support how 1.16 works

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change *

A chunk may not be attached to a world if it is in the process of being * generated.

*

A chunk may not be attached to a {@link World}, or a {@link org.spongepowered.api.world.generation.GenerationRegion} if it is in the process of being * generated.
timeline.author: gabizou
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -45,7 +45,11 @@ * chunk loading from storage, or empty chunks on clients. Traditionally, a * usable "live" proto chunk instance will be a {@link Chunk} with a valid * {@link World} instance.

+ * + *

A chunk may not be attached to a world if it is in the process of being + * generated.

timeline.bodyText: What happened to the reference to the world?
timeline.author: gabizou
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -98,49 +104,22 @@ Vector3i chunkPosition(); /** - * Gets the containing {@link ProtoWorld} of this {@link ProtoChunk}. As - * it may vary based on the status of both {@link Game} and {@link Server}, - * this {@link ProtoChunk} may be likewise used for world generation, in - * which case, the {@link ProtoWorld} would not be a {@link World} instance. + * Gets the {@link Ticks number of ticks} players have been present in this + * chunk, used for calculation of the regional difficulty factor. In vanilla, + * it is increased by the number of players in the chunk every tick, and is + * capped at 3,600,000 ticks (50 hours). * - *

It can be inferred however, that if {@link #state()} returns - * {@link ChunkStates#WORLD_READY}, the {@link ProtoWorld} would be a - * {@link World} instance. Inversely, if {@link #state()} returns - * {@link ChunkStates#EMPTY}, the {@link ProtoWorld} would not be a - * valid {@link World} object.

- * - * @return The parented world + * @return The number of ticks */ - ProtoWorld world();

replies.bodyText: Why shouldn't we be able to soft guarantee that any chunk has a world? Or was it that generating chunks may not actually have the links to the generation regions?
replies.author: gabizou

replies.bodyText: Generating chunks (ProtoChunks) have no link to thier target world or anything that links to something like a GenerationRegion.
replies.author: dualspiral
